intro: Prestonia cyaniphylla, commonly known as the blue-leaved prestonia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage and clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
